speaker: DARREN
line: Hey, I, uh…. I was playing that.

speaker: DARREN
line: Ah, I just went to go take a whiz and now I’m back.

speaker: FEMALE GAME VOICE
line: Even good guys blow it!

speaker: JACK
line: Damn! You got a problem?

speaker: DARREN
line: Uh, uh…. this was my game. I was playing here.

speaker: JACK
line: Were you, pinhead? Now you’re not.

speaker: DARREN
line: Oh … Maybe you didn’t hear me right. I, uh … I said it was my game.

speaker: ZERO
line: It’s his game. Man, I’d step aside if I were you.

speaker: JACK
line: All right. You guys want to play a game. We’ll play a game. We’ll play a game. I go first.

speaker: ZERO
line: Oh, man. You shouldn’t have done that.

speaker: JACK
line: Why. What’s he gonna do?

speaker: DARREN
line: So, is it my turn now?

speaker: JACK
line: I’m not wasting my time.

speaker: DARREN
line: Feel a new record coming on, man.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Both eardrums are ruptured. Cataracts over both eyes. Probably heat-induced.

speaker: MULDER
line: Probably? It looks like his heart was cooked right in his chest.

speaker: STAN THE CORONER
line: I have to admit, I have never seen that kind of localized tissue damage.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Well, there is extensive charring along the sternum with concomitant rib fractures consistent with electrocution or exposure to high voltage direct current. But I see no point of contact.

speaker: STAN THE CORONER
line: Best I could figure the lightning struck the car and killed the kid on contact.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Did you find contact wounds on any of the other five victims?

speaker: STAN THE CORONER
line: I’d have to look at my notes. I mean it’s pretty clear to me what killed these kids.

speaker: MULDER
line: Lightning.

speaker: STAN THE CORONER
line: Well, yeah.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Are you aware that something like 60 people die from lightning strikes across the country each year and five of those happened right here in Connerville?

speaker: STAN THE CORONER
line: I know it’s statistically improbable, but …

speaker: SHERIFF TELLER
line: There were only four deaths. It’s okay, Stan. You don’t have to defend your work. Give us a minute, would you, please?

speaker: STAN THE CORONER
line: Yeah, sure, I’ll be in my office.

speaker: SHERIFF TELLER
line: My name is Teller. I’m with the Johnston County Sheriff’s office. I heard there was an FBI investigation.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Yes, I’m Agent Scully.

speaker: SHERIFF TELLER
line: I know who you are. I just wonder what the hell you’re doing here.

speaker: SCULLY
line: These deaths match other cases of multiple fatalities attributed to lightning with the same inconclusive forensic evidence.

speaker: SHERIFF TELLER
line: Do you know anything about lightening, Agent Scully?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Yes, I know a little.

speaker: SHERIFF TELLER
line: Did you know lightning kills several people at home in the shower or on the phone? That people have seen it dancing on the ground like balls? Scientists will tell you, push come to shove that they really don’t know what makes lightning work at all.

speaker: SCULLY
line: No, I didn’t know that.

speaker: SHERIFF TELLER
line: Well, I know that because I have breakfast with those scientists every morning down at the local diner.

speaker: SCULLY
line: I don’t understand.

speaker: SHERIFF TELLER
line: That’s as clear as glass. Do you know what we manufacture in Connerville? What one of our little local commodities is? We make lightning. Down at the Astadourian Lightning Observatory out on Route 4. 100 ionized rods pointing up into the sky designed to stimulate lightning.

speaker: SCULLY
line: I didn’t know that either.

speaker: SHERIFF TELLER
line: That’s because you didn’t do your homework, did you. You came here to do work that’s already been done.

speaker: SCULLY
line: With all due respect, sir, these autopsies don’t quite add up.

speaker: SHERIFF TELLER
line: Based on what?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Based on my opinion as a medical doctor.

speaker: SHERIFF TELLER
line: Then based on your medical opinion, if you had to give one, what do you think this boy died of?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Well, since there is no other explanation right now, I’d have to concur with the coroner that lightning is the most probable cause of death.

speaker: SHERIFF TELLER
line: And I won’t have you or anyone else suggesting otherwise to this boy’s family.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Feel free to jump in anytime.

speaker: MULDER
line: Why? You were doing just fine.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Do you have a theory on what’s going on here?

speaker: MULDER
line: I just don’t think it’s lightning.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Mulder, wait. What are you expecting to find here?

speaker: MULDER
line: I don’t know yet.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Could you stop for a second, please? Look, after everything that we’ve just been through, after all that we’ve just seen, I hope you’re not thinking this has anything to do with government conspiracies or UFOs.

speaker: MULDER
line: None of the evidence so far indicates either of those possibilities.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Well, what are you looking for? I mean, just because a forensic profile isn’t cut and dried doesn’t mean it’s not true.

speaker: MULDER
line: So Teller’s explanation works for you?

speaker: SCULLY
line: The only possible scientific conclusion is that Jack Hammond was killed by lightning.

speaker: MULDER
line: Well, then this local lightening is a lot more predictable than Teller realizes. It seems to have a definite preference for the type of person it strikes.

speaker: SCULLY
line: What are you talking about?

speaker: MULDER
line: Well, look at the files, look at all the other victims, they’re all male age 17 to 21, just like Jack Hammond. At least let’s go see where Jack Hammond was killed. Maybe we’ll find something we both can agree on.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Police found Hammond in his car at 17 minutes past midnight. The entire electrical system was shorted out. All the circuitry and wiring had melted.

speaker: MULDER
line: Looks like he was trying to get away in a big hurry.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Get away from what?

speaker: MULDER
line: What time was Jack Hammond’s last pizza delivery?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Sometime between 11:00 and 11:30. Why?

speaker: MULDER
line: All these stores would have been closed by 11:00 except maybe this one.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Excuse me.

speaker: SCULLY
line: What’s your name?

speaker: ZERO
line: Uh, … Zero.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Zero, do you mind if we talk for a minute?

speaker: ZERO
line: What for?

speaker: SCULLY
line: I’m with the FBI.

speaker: ZERO
line: All right.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Were you working here last night?

speaker: ZERO
line: Sure. Every night.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Do you recognize this person?

speaker: ZERO
line: Nah, never seen him.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Why don’t you take a closer look. He was here between So, if you were standing here at this counter you must have seen it happen.

speaker: ZERO
line: Oh, that was him.

speaker: ZERO
line: Last I saw, dude fed a bunch of quarters into this one. Then the ambulance shows up.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Before the ambulance showed up did you notice anything unusual outside?

speaker: ZERO
line: It’s hard to tell. The place gets pretty loud and all. Kind of hard to hear much of anything.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Did you notice anyone else around who might have seen something?

speaker: ZERO
line: I can’t .. uh … I don’t really remember.

speaker: MULDER
line: Look, Scully, take a look at this.

speaker: SCULLY
line: What?

speaker: MULDER
line: What were the names of the other victims?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Uh… Corey Huffard, Darren Oswald, Burke Roberts and Billy ---

speaker: MULDER
line: Darren Oswald. What’s his middle name?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Darren Peter. Why?

speaker: MULDER
line: DPO. Darren Peter Oswald. Of the five victims wasn’t he the only one to survive?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Yes.

speaker: MULDER
line: Well, he was here last night.

speaker: DARREN
line: Hey, Mrs. Kiveat.

speaker: SHARON
line: God, Darren, you scared me.

speaker: DARREN
line: What?

speaker: SHARON
line: Where’s Frank?

speaker: DARREN
line: Oh, he’s out on a tow. Is there anything I can help you with?

speaker: SHARON
line: No. No, we’re supposed to go to dinner.

speaker: DARREN
line: Are you hungry? I can get you something to eat. You want something? I got jelly doughnuts.

speaker: SHARON
line: No. Thank you.

speaker: DARREN
line: Are you sure? They’re from yesterday, but they’re still good. I had one. Hey. Mrs. Kiveat? Uh… about those things that I said yesterday, I …

speaker: KIVEAT
line: Sorry I’m late, hon. I had to tow that poor pizza delivery kid’s car. Nice to see you. Oh, hey Darren. I got a call on the radio. Some people are coming to see you. They say they’re with the FBI.

speaker: DARREN
line: This is the dude that died, right? It’s pretty harsh, man. So how’d it happen?

speaker: MULDER
line: They say he was struck by lightning.

speaker: DARREN
line: Yeah, that happens.

speaker: MULDER
line: Right outside the video arcade. Not a cloud in the sky from what we can tell. You were there last night, weren’t you? Broke your own record too.

speaker: DARREN
line: Yeah.

speaker: MULDER
line: You must have seen something.

speaker: DARREN
line: Oh, no, man, when I’m into my game, man, I’m there, you know? It’s like a nuclear explosion could go off, right, and I wouldn’t even notice.

speaker: MULDER
line: Can I ask you a personal question?

speaker: DARREN
line: Yeah.

speaker: MULDER
line: Do you consider yourself a lucky person?

speaker: DARREN
line: Me?

speaker: MULDER
line: Yeah.

speaker: DARREN
line: I don’t think so.

speaker: MULDER
line: I’m just thinking about all the people that got hit by lightning, you’re the only one to survive. Don’t you think you’re lucky?

speaker: DARREN
line: Yeah, I guess if you look at it like that you could be right. I could be considered lucky.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Mulder.

speaker: MULDER
line: Yeah?

speaker: SCULLY
line: What’s in your pocket?

speaker: SCULLY
line: What happened?

speaker: MULDER
line: I don’t know. It just got hot all of a sudden.

speaker: DARREN
line: Bummer. I’m going to go now.

speaker: MULDER
line: Thanks for your help.

speaker: DARREN
line: Yep. I’ll see you.

speaker: TV TALK SHOW
line: And, um, and I've always been, ever since I was a teenager I've been into piercing and sadomasochism and, um, rebellion, extremism. That's something I think that's skipped over.

speaker: MRS OSWALD
line: Quit fooling with the remote.

speaker: TV TALK SHOW
line: I used to sleep in a belt at night…

speaker: DARREN
line: Why do you watch that stuff, anyway? They’re a bunch of losers.

speaker: MRS OSWALD
line: At least they’re on TV. I don’t see you on TV.

speaker: MRS OSWALD
line: Manners don’t cost, Darren. They’re FREE! What girl’s going to want a belching fool like you?

speaker: ZERO
line: Hey, Darren?

speaker: DARREN
line: Maybe you’d be surprised.

speaker: ZERO
line: Dude?

speaker: ZERO
line: You won’t believe it, man. You won’t believe who came by today.

speaker: DARREN
line: Let me guess. The FBI?

speaker: ZERO
line: How did you know?

speaker: DARREN
line: They came by the garage.

speaker: ZERO
line: They did!? How did they find you?

speaker: DARREN
line: You tell me. You must have said something.

speaker: ZERO
line: No, man, I didn’t say squat. Wait up. Come on, man. You know I wouldn’t do that to you.

speaker: DARREN
line: I think you want to be someplace else right now. ‘Cause I’m in the mood for a little barbecue.

speaker: ZERO
line: No. Man. Not the cows, again. Come on, don’t. Don’t do this. Not now.

speaker: DARREN
line: All right, I’m listening! I’m ready.

speaker: ZERO
line: Don’t do it man.

speaker: DARREN
line: I’m ready, so come on down!

speaker: ZERO
line: I’m outta here!

speaker: DARREN
line: I’m right here. Come and get me! Come on man! I’m waiting. Come on, man, talk to me! Come ON!!!!!!

speaker: ZERO
line: Dude? Are you okay, man?

speaker: DARREN
line: Excellent.

speaker: SHERIFF TELLER
line: Well, have that faxed to my office. Yeah, right away if you can. Thank you, Dean. I appreciate it.

speaker: SCULLY
line: What happened here, Sheriff?

speaker: SHERIFF TELLER
line: Three dead cows. How do you think they died?

speaker: MULDER
line: Lightning.

speaker: SHERIFF TELLER
line: That’s right. I just got off with Dean Greiner at the observatory, which by the way is just about a mile through those trees.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Did they report lightning last night?

speaker: SHERIFF TELLER
line: They can detect every flash of lightning on this planet. Did you know that? Each one emits radio waves at the same exact frequency.

speaker: MULDER
line: The Schuman Resonance. Eight cycles per second. You can pick it up on any transistor radio. You see that, Sheriff? I did my homework.

speaker: SHERIFF TELLER
line: Not much question that lightning killed these cows last night. Just like it killed Jack Hammond the night before last.

speaker: MULDER
line: Oh, that’s certainly the way it looks.

speaker: SHERIFF TELLER
line: Let me show you something else. It’s right over here. You see this? Do you know what this is?

speaker: MULDER
line: Looks like a fulgurite. That only happens with lightning … when sandy soil fuses into glass from the heat of a discharge.

speaker: SHERIFF TELLER
line: How much more proof do you need? I’d say your business here is finished.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Mulder, I’d have to say I think he’s right.

speaker: MULDER
line: That we’re wasting our time chasing lightning?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Well, look at the evidence. What else could it be?

speaker: MULDER
line: I don’t know yet. This is the first lightning strike I’ve ever seen that left behind a footprint.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Here we go. Well, considering it’s a partial imprint there’s a lot of information here.

speaker: MULDER
line: That’s great. Now can you make me a little cherub that squirts water?

speaker: SCULLY
line: The tread looks like a standard military boot … men’s … size 8½.

speaker: MULDER
line: 8½? That’s pretty impressive, Scully.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Well, it says it right here on the bottom.

speaker: MULDER
line: Oooo.

speaker: SCULLY
line: But I may have something even better. When I was cleaning the imprint to take the mold I found trace amounts of a viscous substance actually imbedded in the fulgurite.

speaker: MULDER
line: What is it?

speaker: SCULLY
line: I’d have to conduct a chemical analysis to be sure, but, uh … it looks like antifreeze.

speaker: MULDER
line: Darren Oswald.

speaker: SCULLY
line: But why? And how?

speaker: MULDER
line: I don’t know, Scully, but lets go see if the shoe fits.

speaker: ZERO
line: Dude! What’s happening? What’s going on?

speaker: DARREN
line: Ah, I don’t know. Nothin’.

speaker: ZERO
line: You know, I been thinking …

speaker: DARREN
line: First time for everything.

speaker: DARREN
line: Ah, damn. ABS brakes.

speaker: ZERO
line: I’m thinking we should go somewhere ….get out of this hole. Maybe check out Las Vegas. *You* could do some serious damage someplace like that.

speaker: DARREN
line: I’m not going to Las Vegas. I’m not going anywhere, not without Mrs. Kiveat.

speaker: ZERO
line: What makes you think she’s going to want to go anywhere with you? She failed you, remember? She thinks you’re a retard.

speaker: DARREN
line: Forget school, man. I’m talking about proving my love.

speaker: ZERO
line: How you going to do that?

speaker: DARREN
line: By letting her know how I feel … how all I ever think about is being with her.

speaker: ZERO
line: Wake up, dude. There’s another slight problem. She’s married to your boss.

speaker: DARREN
line: Maybe I could fry him.

speaker: ZERO
line: Dude, he’s your boss.

speaker: DARREN
line: Not if he’s dead he won’t be.

speaker: ZERO
line: Are you high? With the FBI hanging around? Forget about it, okay? You can’t compete with Frank. He’s good-looking, he’s got his own shop plus, he fixes things instead of just smashing stuff up. A woman like that … wants someone special.

speaker: DARREN
line: I’m special.

speaker: ZERO
line: Yeah, right.

speaker: DARREN
line: No, I’m gonna show her just how special I am.

speaker: DARREN
line: Whoa! That was a good one. Come on, man. Let’s go check it out!

speaker: MRS OSWALD
line: Darren ain’t worth much. I’m the first one to say it, but he wouldn’t hurt a soul. What kind of trouble’s he in, anyway?

speaker: MULDER
line: Can we have a few minutes, Mrs. Oswald? Thank you.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Mulder …

speaker: MULDER
line: Yeah?

speaker: SCULLY
line: We’ve got a size match.

speaker: MULDER
line: Eight ½?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Yeah, but it still doesn’t prove that he killed Jack Hammond.

speaker: SCULLY
line: I’m surprised you haven’t already read that issue.

speaker: MULDER
line: Oh, I have. April is the cruelest month. But mine didn’t come with this. I found that between Miss April and "Women of the Ivy League."

speaker: SCULLY
line: Who is she?

speaker: MULDER
line: I don’t know, but it looks like it’s from some kind of yearbook photo, see?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Mm-hmm. there’s a yearbook in Darren’s closet.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Her name is Sharon Kiveat.

speaker: MULDER
line: Kiveat… the garage where Darren works is called Kiveat Auto Body.

speaker: KIVEAT
line: What happened?

speaker: TRAFFIC COP
line: Some kid got center-punched. Just got his license too. He’s pretty bad off.

speaker: KIVEAT
line: Geez. That’s rough. You guys ready for me to start clearing the road?

speaker: TRAFFIC COP
line: I’m just directing traffic. You’d better check with the deputy. Hey, pal, are you okay?

speaker: KIVEAT
line: Yeah.

speaker: TRAFFIC COP
line: You don’t look so good.

speaker: TRAFFIC COP
line: Hey, somebody get the EMS guys! Take … take it easy. You’re gonna be okay.

speaker: EMS 1
line: What happened?

speaker: TRAFFIC COP
line: He just collapsed.

speaker: EMS 1
line: Pulse is thready.

speaker: EST 2
line: I’ll get the kit.

speaker: EMS 1
line: Yeah. It’s all right, buddy. Here we go.

speaker: ZERO
line: Where you going? What are you doing? Let’s get out of here.

speaker: EMS 1
line: Let’s have it. I got one, two, three. All right. Give me 300 Joules.

speaker: EMS 2
line: It’s already charged.

speaker: EMS 1
line: No, it’s not. Something’s not working here. Get the backup. Come on.

speaker: DARREN
line: Don’t worry, Mr. Kiveat. I’ve seen how they do it on TV.

speaker: EMS 1
line: Wait …. we got a rhythm. How the hell…..?

speaker: DARREN
line: Rescue 911.

speaker: MULDER
line: Let me give you a hand with that.

speaker: SHARON
line: Thank you.

speaker: MULDER
line: Mrs. Kiveat? My name is Fox Mulder. I’m with the FBI. I know this is a hard time but I’d like to ask you some questions.

speaker: SHARON
line: You were in my husband’s garage yesterday.

speaker: MULDER
line: Yes.

speaker: SHARON
line: I’m sorry, I can’t.

speaker: MULDER
line: I’d like to ask you about Darren Oswald. He was at the scene of the accident, wasn’t he?

speaker: SHARON
line: Please, I need to see my husband.

speaker: SCULLY
line: I just talked to one of the EMS workers. He was pretty rattled.

speaker: MULDER
line: Why?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Frank Kiveat’s electrocardiogram. See that spike there? That indicates that some kind of electrical intervention started his heart. Except according to the EMS worker, the defibrillator wouldn’t charge. The paddles were dead.

speaker: MULDER
line: How did he explain this?

speaker: SCULLY
line: He didn’t. All he saw was Darren Oswald touching Kiveat’s chest.

speaker: MULDER
line: I’ve been going over Oswald’s chart. There’s something I want you to take a look at.

speaker: SCULLY
line: He was admitted to the ER five months ago in cardiac arrest. Respiratory failure. Class three burns on the back of his skull … resuscitated after …Hang on, this is odd. His blood test showed acute hypokalemia.

speaker: MULDER
line: Yeah. What is that?

speaker: SCULLY
line: A severe chemical imbalance characterized by high sodium and low potassium levels.

speaker: MULDER
line: Electrolytes, right?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Yeah.

speaker: MULDER
line: And what do electrolytes do?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Well, among other things they generate the electrical impulses in our bodies. Like every time our heart beats or a neuron fires….

speaker: MULDER
line: Okay, it’s a leap, Scully, but what if Oswald’s electrolyte imbalance is somehow enabling him to generate electricity at levels much higher than normal?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Our body doesn’t work like that …

speaker: MULDER
line: Unless his body is abnormally conductive. Because if that heel print is Oswald’s, that means he conducted millions of volts of electricity into the ground and then just walked away.

speaker: SCULLY
line: You’re saying he’s some kind of lightning rod?

speaker: MULDER
line: No, I’m saying that he *is* lightning and we’ve got to get to him before he strikes again.

speaker: MULDER
line: Darren. Darren! Darren …

speaker: DARREN
line: Don’t you touch me, man!

speaker: MULDER
line: Relax, Darren.

speaker: DARREN
line: Don’t you touch me!

speaker: SCULLY
line: We just want to talk to you, that’s all. Just ask you a few more questions.

speaker: DARREN
line: I didn’t do anything.

speaker: DARREN
line: How many times do I have to say it? I don’t know how all those people died.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Why did you run when you saw us?

speaker: DARREN
line: I was taking a walk. Now, that’s not against the law, is it? Anyway, you guys should be giving me a medal. I mean, I saved my boss’s life.

speaker: SCULLY
line: We’re not so sure.

speaker: DARREN
line: Why? Who told you that? Who have you been talking to? You been talking to Zero? He the one who told you that?

speaker: MULDER
line: What did he say?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Not much. Except that he’s a hero.

speaker: MULDER
line: How did he say he revived Kiveat?

speaker: SCULLY
line: CPR. He claims he paid attention in health class.

speaker: MULDER
line: I don’t think he just resuscitated Frank Kiveat, Scully. I think he set the whole thing up.

speaker: SCULLY
line: How? By causing Kiveat’s heart attack?

speaker: MULDER
line: Did you see what he did to my phone?

speaker: SCULLY
line: So what? Are we supposed to charge him with assaulting a cellular phone?

speaker: MULDER
line: I think we should run a full set of lab tests on this kid, Scully.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Mulder, look where we are. We don’t have the capability or time to perform those tests. And without a confession we can only keep him in custody for 72 hours.

speaker: MULDER
line: I can think of only one other person that might be able to help us.

speaker: MULDER
line: Mrs. Kiveat.

speaker: SHARON
line: Please, I … I can’t do this now. I’m, I’m just leaving for the hospital.

speaker: MULDER
line: Darren Oswald’s in custody, Mrs. Kiveat. We arrested him this afternoon. But we can’t press criminal charges without your help.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Is it okay if we come in?

speaker: SHARON
line: I teach remedial reading at the high school. Darren was my student.

speaker: SCULLY
line: How would you describe your relationship with him?

speaker: SHARON
line: Well, I’m not blind. I knew he had a crush on me, but, uh … I felt sorry for him. I thought he was just … I, I, it just seemed he had more than his share of bad luck.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Did you get him the job at your husband’s garage?

speaker: SHARON
line: Yeah, and then, about six months ago, I started getting these phone calls. Someone would call and then hang up.

speaker: SCULLY
line: How did you know it was Darren?

speaker: SHARON
line: The way he looked at me in the garage -- the phone calls made me feel the same way. I just knew.

speaker: MULDER
line: When did you first suspect that Darren was involved in something more than prank calls?

speaker: SHARON
line: He told me.

speaker: MULDER
line: He actually confessed to killing those people?

speaker: SHARON
line: No, but he told me that he had … powers. Dangerous powers.

speaker: MULDER
line: When was this?

speaker: SHARON
line: Right after the last boy was killed.

speaker: MULDER
line: Jack Hammond?

speaker: SHARON
line: See, at first, I didn’t believe him. I thought he was just mouthing off. But after what happened today …

speaker: MULDER
line: Did you tell anyone?

speaker: SHARON
line: Who would have believed me? And I was afraid. I was afraid of what he might do to me and what he would …. do to my husband.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Well, you don’t have to be afraid any more. You and your husband are safe as long as we can count on your testimony.

speaker: MULDER
line: Where’s Oswald?

speaker: SHERIFF TELLER
line: I sent him home.

speaker: MULDER
line: You released him? When?

speaker: SHERIFF TELLER
line: After I read your arrest report.

speaker: MULDER
line: I’ll go call Sharon Kiveat.

speaker: SHERIFF TELLER
line: "Suspicion of homicide by emission of direct electric current?" You don’t really believe this.

speaker: SCULLY
line: I believe that Darren Oswald was involved somehow in the deaths of those four people. And I believe it was irresponsible for you to let him go.

speaker: SHERIFF TELLER
line: Let me get this straight, now. You’re telling me this kid’s throwing lightning bolts.

speaker: SCULLY
line: In effect.

speaker: SHERIFF TELLER
line: In effect? There’s no scientific basis for that claim. This is speculation based on nothing. You have no hard evidence, no proof…

speaker: SCULLY
line: You said yourself, Sheriff, not even science can explain how lightning works.

speaker: MULDER
line: Mrs. Kiveat’s not home.

speaker: SCULLY
line: She’s on her way to the hospital.

speaker: ZERO
line: Dude? Come on, man, where are you? What are you doing, man?! I said I didn’t tell them! God! I didn’t say nothing, man! I swear! Why are you doing this, man! We’re buddies!

speaker: MULDER
line: Excuse me, miss? Call security. Have them deny entry to the hospital to everyone except emergency personnel.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Sharon?

speaker: SHARON
line: What is it?

speaker: SCULLY
line: We need you to come with us right away.

speaker: SHARON
line: Why? What’s wrong?

speaker: MULDER
line: Darren Oswald. He was released from custody.

speaker: SHARON
line: But how? How - how could that happen? You said that we didn’t have to worry, that we were safe.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Look, we don’t have much time. Come with us and we’ll tell you everything.

speaker: SHARON
line: The doctor said my husband cannot leave this room. I am not going to leave him here.

speaker: MULDER
line: I’ll stay with him. Go with Agent Scully.

speaker: SHARON
line: No.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Sharon, please.

speaker: MULDER
line: He’s here.

speaker: SCULLY
line: He’s dead.

speaker: NURSE
line: Oh my God.

speaker: SCULLY
line: How many other access points to this floor?

speaker: NURSE
line: Other than the elevator, just the stairway.

speaker: MULDER
line: Stay with them.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Mulder!

speaker: MULDER
line: I’m going after Oswald.

speaker: DARREN
line: Mrs. Kiveat?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Darren, don’t move.

speaker: DARREN
line: Where is she?

speaker: SCULLY
line: I said don’t move. Darren.

speaker: DARREN
line: Mrs. Kiveat?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Stop. I’m warning you.

speaker: DARREN
line: All right, come with me. Please, Mrs. Kiveat because there’s some things … there’s stuff that I need to tell you.

speaker: SCULLY
line: I want you step back inside that room.

speaker: DARREN
line: Are you coming with me, Mrs. Kiveat?

speaker: SCULLY
line: She’s not going anywhere with you, Darren.

speaker: DARREN
line: I can hurt you.

speaker: SCULLY
line: I can hurt you too. I’m going to give you three seconds. One …

speaker: DARREN
line: Now, I’m done fooling around now!

speaker: MRS. KIVEAT
line: Stop it! I’ll go with you. Okay? If that’s what you want, I’ll go. Just … stop it.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Sharon, we can work this all out, right here.

speaker: SHARON
line: No, we can’t.

speaker: DARREN
line: All right. All right, then.

speaker: DARREN
line: You were the only person that was ever nice to me. You know that? I mean .. Hey, you remember that first day in class when you wore that green dress with the yellow flowers on it? And when you stood in front of the window you could almost see through it?

speaker: SHARON
line: Where - where are we going? Where are you taking me?

speaker: DARREN
line: I don’t know. Anywhere you want to go. I got money from a cash machine, you know. Plus, you know, we can take any car you want. You know, you just take your pick, you know. I mean, we can take an Accord or a Maxima. Do you like any of those? Or hey, you know, if you don’t want to go Japanese, you know, how about a Taurus?

speaker: DARREN
line: Nah, you’re right. You know, all these cars suck. We’ll just boost one of them for right now and then, we’ll trade it later.

speaker: DARREN
line: Just take it easy, Mrs. Kiveat, all right?

speaker: DARREN
line: No. Mrs. Kiveat?

speaker: SHERIFF TELLER
line: Hey! Come over here. Come on over here!

speaker: DARREN
line: Mrs. Kiveat? Mrs. Kiveat, where are you? Ah, come on now. I said I’d take care of you! What else did you want? I’d have given you anything. Anything you wanted! Mrs. Kiveat!

speaker: SHERIFF TELLER
line: Ok, son. Turn around. Let’s go. Look, I don’t know what trouble you’re up to but I want some answers.

speaker: DARREN
line: NO!! I WANT SOME ANSWERS!! Where is she? Come on, now, you’re PISSING ME OFF!!!

speaker: MULDER
line: Teller, get out of there!

speaker: DARREN
line: TELLL MEEE WHERE SHE IS!!!!!!!!!

speaker: SCULLY
line: I just got off the phone with the coroner. He’s ruling Teller’s death accidental.

speaker: MULDER
line: Lightning? What about the scientists at the observatory? What do they have to say?

speaker: SCULLY
line: They also reported lightning last night. I talked to the DA. He has no idea how to begin building a case.

speaker: MULDER
line: What about the tests I asked for?

speaker: SCULLY
line: They came in five minutes ago.

speaker: MULDER
line: And?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Nothing unusual was detected, Mulder. The electrolytes, the blood gas levels, brain wave activity. Based on the science of all the data that’s been gathered …

speaker: MULDER
line: … Darren Oswald is a perfectly normal, perfectly healthy kid. You believe that, Scully? Neither do I.
